questions.question: What form should a person receive from an employer by January 31 to complete his/her annual tax paperwork?

choices.answer: Form I-9 for the previous year
Medicare form for the current year
Form W-4 for the previous year
Form W-2 for the previous year

questions.question: Which form will determine how much money is withheld from your paycheck for federal and state income taxes?

choices.answer: The amount of money earned from doing additional work for a company.
The total amount of money earned before pay deductions.
The length of time an employee's wages are calculated.
The amount of money left after all deductions have been taken.

questions.question: Each of the following taxes is typically withheld from your paycheck, EXCEPT?
When do you start paying taxes?

choices.answer: When you make more than the minimum income requirement.
When you are notified by the IRS that you are required to pay federal incom
When you get a full-time job (part-time does not count).

questions.question: What does the term "withholding" mean in reference to your paycheck?

choices.answer: It is how much you earn and includes salary, bonus and commissions.
It is the amount of your paycheck that you are NOT being taxed on.
It is how much you are going to owe the government when you file your annua
It is how much is being taken out of your paycheck in taxes.

questions.question: The form W-2 is also known as a Wage and Tax Statement.
If you didn't file your taxes by April 15th or request an extension you will NOT be assessed fees.
When starting a job, what form is used to prove that you are eligible to work in the U.S.?
Which of the following is NOT a way to file your taxes?
The W-2 Form is important because it includes information about the interest you earned from your investments.
Which of the following is an employee's responsibility concerning income or payroll taxes?

choices.answer: Send withholding amounts to the federal government
Determine how much tax to withhold based on W-4 information

questions.question: Our tax money is spent on all of the following EXCEPT:
FICA stands for Federal Insurance Contributions Act.
Tax Evasion is the failure to pay legally due taxes.
